summary: 12/30/2005: A remote-controlled bomb killed four Afghan police officers and injured seven others at a checkpoint in Helmand Province’s Hazar Joft (District). Taliban spokesman, Mohammad Yousuf Ahmadi, claimed responsibility for the bombing.
target1: Afghanistan Police Forces in Helmand Province
weapdetail: The Taliban spokesman mentioned that the bomb was a remote detonated device.
propcomment: It is unknown if there was any property damage.
addnotes: One more of many Taliban attacks on police forces in Afghanistan. The bomb was said to have been planted just outside the check post.
scite1: “AFP: Suspected Taliban Bomb Kills 4 Afghan Policemen,” Agence France Presse, December 30, 2005.
